intro: Verbascum pterocalycinum var. mutense, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mullein, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its fuzzy, gray-green leaves and tall spikes of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. It is valued for its medicinal properties, with historical use in treating respiratory ailments. Its distinctive appearance and ecological adaptability make it a notable species in its native habitat.
